item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S7924-7926; text as passed Senate: CR S7925; text of measure as introduced: CR S7914)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S7924-7926; text as passed Senate: CR S7925; text of measure as introduced: CR S7914)

summary.text: Suspends provisions of rule IV of the Rules for the Regulation of the Senate Wing of the Capitol and Senate Office Buildings (prohibiting the taking of pictures in the Senate Chamber) to permit the C-SPAN television network to take video images of the Senate Chamber, during a period the Senate is in recess, solely for inclusion in a documentary on the history of the Capitol which the network is preparing.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Suspends provisions of rule IV of the Rules for the Regulation of the Senate Wing of the Capitol and Senate Office Buildings (prohibiting the taking of pictures in the Senate Chamber) to permit the C-SPAN television network to take video images of the Senate Chamber, during a period the Senate is in recess, solely for inclusion in a documentary on the history of the Capitol which the network is preparing.

bill.title: A resolution authorizing the taking of video images in the Chamber of the United States Senate.

item.title: A resolution authorizing the taking of video images in the Chamber of the United States Senate.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
